intro: Microcos semlikiensis, commonly known as the Semliki microcos, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
